title: Ticket #5298: File transfer timestamps broken
description:
In Condor 7.7, we added information in the job ad about file transfer times (#2783). This includes the attribute JobCurrentStartTransferOutputDate, which records the timestamp when output transfer began. In 7.9, improvements to file transfer management broken this attribute (#3333), so that it no longer appears in the job ad.

The problem is that the FileTransfer object records the start and end times of transfers in the Upload() and Download() methods. When a transfer is done in non-blocking mode, this happens in the child process, and the times are not sent back to the parent process.
attachments:
• transfer_times.patch 1327 bytes added by jfrey on 2015-Oct-08 15:34:15 UTC.
    Fix missing JobCurrentStartTransferOutputDate attribute in job ad. FileTransfer object now records transfer start and end times in non-blocking mode.
check_ins:

2015-Oct-12 14:50   Check-in [45963]: Fix FileTransfer timestamps for non-blocking mode. #5298 Record timestamps for the start and end of transfers when in non-blocking mode. Previously, they were recorded only for blocking mode. One side-effect is that the JobCurrentStartTransferOutputDate attribute is once more reported in the job ad. [...] (By Jaime Frey )
